intro: Hieracium isophyllotum, commonly known as the equal-leaf hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, featuring upright stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a rough texture, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium isophyllotum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
